alert.note: Alert for Mayes; Rogers; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 5:30AM CDT until June 10 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Oklahoma and northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, in east central Oklahoma, Cherokee. In northeast Oklahoma, Adair, Delaware, Mayes, Rogers and Wagoner. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 530 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - 1 to 2 inches of rain have already fallen with additional 1 to 2 inches of rain possible before ending. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tahlequah... Pryor... Pryor Creek... Chouteau... Inola... Locust Grove... Salina... Kansas... Hulbert... Oaks... Peggs... Rose... Leach... Sportsmen Acres Community... Scraper... Twin Oaks... Eldon... Proctor... Lost City... Murphy... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
